comment: Johnson is a nice guy but you have to love Philosophy and really teach the material to yourself to do well. I would never take his class again.
Oh my god, avoid!  I fell asleep each time I went to class. So scatter brained and not orderly.  I don't so much money for this nonsense. Teach or don't teach and do it properly!!
Talks slow and lectures are drawn out but a nice guy. Three fair tests. Not good about answering questions. But still a good class.

I took this class during Maymester. We had good discussions in class. The professor was very easy going. Read the questions on the exams very carefully and pick the BEST answer. There are usually more than one correct answer to the question.

The class can be quickly ruined by having really opinionated people in the class. The class is just one giant argument. I was hoping it would be more content and less arguments, because i like knowing what people believe not arguing over what people believe. Take communications instead.

Wow. I really thought I was going to enjoy Philosophy. NOT! Prof seems to be a really nice guy but I don't think he's a very good teacher. Late, doesn't show up. TESTS are NOT open book! I took this prof based on what I read here and it was all wrong. He obviously changed EVERYTHING since those reviews were written back in 2010.

HE IS AWFUL! I read all of the rate my professor comments before I decided to take him and thought it would be a good class. Boy, i was wrong. He doesn't show up sometimes, never responds to emails, is completely offfensive, and is totally in the clouds 24/7. I would never take him again.
An entry in this field was reqired by RMP.
Took him for Maymester, lectures are long and boring but interesting. Tests are open book with notes allowed. He is fair when grading, curves a lot. Nice guy, I would take him again!

Very boring, like others have said, some questions on the test were not covered in lecture or in the book, but the tests are open book, with written notes in the book allowed. He does seem to be high most of the time, and doesn't know a single students' name.

I took this class to fill out a core requirement. He's a pretty average professor. he can sometimes get off topic and it can be a little boring, but you will learn something of you want to. There are only 4 tests and they are open book and he allows you to take notes on the margins. If you read the book and A is almost Guaranteed

Lectures are long and boring. Tests are open book, so just put notes in there. Some test questions are confusing even though it is open book. Never takes attendance. Occasionally lets out late. Will raise test grades a few points based on if a lot of people miss a question. If you have to take philosophy, I would recommend a different professor.

the worst class i have ever taken. his lectures go in circles and the jokes he makes are off color and rude. he argues with his students and there is no reasoning with him. SUPER slow to return grades, and i'm pretty sure he's high all the time. if you get stuck with him, go to class and take your notes in the margins; his tests are open book.
Really great guy. However, his teaching is not for me. Long lectures, Boring style, hard to get the point of his analogies. If I had it to do over I would have taken someone else.

as a person he is great! as a teacher, the worst one i have ever had. his lectures were spacey and LONG! tests were VERY difficult, even if you show up unless you really LOVE the material you will do bad

Professor Johnson is an excellent teacher. He does argue, but objectively, in order to help students see different philosophical viewpoints. He is very personable, and does present the material very clearly! The concepts can get complex, but he does very well in making sense of them. A favorite teacher of mine at KSU, would recommend to all.

Teacher is really weird, likes to ramble on & on, I ended up having NO idea what he was talking about most classes; very nice tho. Final grade only based on 3 tests which is stressful; open book tests, but still read the material - very confusing & a lot on info. Doesn't take attendance. Some tests are take home essay style which aren't too bad.

Buy a used, marked up book and you'll be fine.  His tests are open book and as long as you know where to find the information, you'll do fine.  Beyond fair with his tests, but part of that could have been due to Maymester.
A little spacey but an interesting class.  Don't let the staring bother you - - he's just taking in your question.  Takes forever to return grades, if you have any at all.
Confusing

I've enjoyed his class so far. He does ramble/argue, but it is related to the text. Tests aren't bad and you can use your book, and he throws out questions. Take this class if you want to discuss philosophy rather than just read.
he's one of the worst teachers at KSU.  very unclear, rude, and I'm pretty sure he was high every class.  don't waste you're time with him!

I took him Spring 2007 and his class was terrible. He always argued with the class and never actually taught. If I had a viewpoint different than his, he mocked me and asked the class to laugh at me as well. Very Strange man. Didn't like him or his class whatsoever. He has no regards for time and kept us way past 315 everyday. It was awful.

This class was easy and interesting.  Yes he is argumentative, but he is just trying to get the class to understand the material.  I thought he was really nice and funny. He is very helpful, changes test times and gives questions away if the class votes they were too difficult! Doesn't get easier than that.

Although Professor Johnson did go on rants sometimes, his tests were easy if you read the material. He even let you use your book during the tests. Sometimes he wasn't very clear, but he was willing to answer any questions I had and was generally a nice teacher. He only had 3 grades the whole semester, though, so there was pressure.

Although Philosophy is a difficult class in general, professor Johnson was one of the worst profs I've ever had. He NEVER actually teaches, he just rambles. He iinsists on his own way & if you try to ask a question, he ends up wanting to argue with you. He seeks a fight with his students. Do not take his class. Take Robinson!
